title: 'Resign immediately': Rohit Sharma under fire as Australia dominate India at The Gabba - The Times of India
summary:
'Resign immediately': Rohit Sharma under fire as Australia dominate India at The Gabba

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma is facing significant backlash after India's underwhelming performance in the ongoing third Test against Australia at The Gabba, with fans questioning his captaincy decisions as Australia gains control of the match.

  • India won the toss and chose to field, a decision criticized by many fans.
  • At 297/3 in 80 overs, Australia's strong batting performance has intensified scrutiny on Rohit's decisions.
  • Fans are vocal about their dissatisfaction, with calls for Rohit's resignation trending on social media.
  • The team's inability to capitalize on key moments has compounded criticism of Rohit's leadership.
“He's just not meant for this job, he needs to accept it and resign immediately after this Test irrespective of the outcome of this match.”

As the Test match progresses, the pressure on Rohit Sharma continues to mount, leading to serious questions about his future as captain and the overall leadership direction of Indian cricket.

title: FIDE slams claims of Liren losing World Chess Championship match to Gukesh on purpose: 'Every sportsman makes mistakes' - Firstpost
summary:
FIDE slams claims of Liren losing World Chess Championship match to Gukesh on purpose: 'Every sportsman makes mistakes'

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Firstpost

The International Chess Federation (FIDE) President Arkady Dvorkovich has dismissed allegations that Ding Liren lost the World Chess Championship match to D Gukesh intentionally, praising both players for their performances.

  • D Gukesh won the 2024 World Chess Championship, making him the second Indian champion after Viswanathan Anand.
  • Ding Liren made a critical blunder in Game 14, which cost him the match and title.
  • Vladimir Kramnik and the Russian Chess Federation raised doubts about the nature of Liren's loss.
  • Despite criticism from Magnus Carlsen, Viswanathan Anand supported Gukesh and encouraged him to disregard negative feedback.
  • Gukesh became the youngest-ever World Chess Champion at 18, breaking Garry Kasparov's record.
“Sports is about mistakes, without mistakes, there would be no goals in football. Every sportsman makes mistakes but that’s what we are excited about..." - Arkady Dvorkovich

In conclusion, the FIDE President's remarks highlight the unpredictability of chess, while Gukesh's historic victory continues to generate discussion and debate in the chess community.

Bucks dispatch Hawks, advance to NBA Cup title game - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bucks dispatch Hawks, advance to NBA Cup title game

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 08:09 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

The Milwaukee Bucks secured a spot in the NBA Cup final after defeating the Atlanta Hawks 110-102, propelled by a strong performance from Giannis Antetokounmpo and crucial contributions from Damian Lillard.

  • Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 30 points, 12 rebounds, and 8 assists.
  • Damian Lillard contributed 25 points, hitting 5 out of 14 three-pointers.
  • Trae Young led the Hawks with 35 points and 10 assists but fell short of a triple-double.
  • The Bucks outscored the Hawks 28-19 in the fourth quarter to secure their victory.
  • Milwaukee will face either the Oklahoma Thunder or Houston Rockets in the final on Tuesday.
"Giannis scored 10 of his 32 points in the fourth quarter to push the Bucks over the hump."

Overall, the Bucks’ ability to perform in the clutch time and their defensive strategy in the fourth quarter were critical in overcoming the Hawks and advancing to the title game.

summary:
Mohammed Siraj riles up Gabba crowd, Australia with 'bail flip', Marnus Labuschagne responds - Watch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Mohammed Siraj continued his lively antics during the Border Gavaskar Trophy, notably at the Gabba, where he engaged the crowd and fellow cricketer Marnus Labuschagne with a 'bail flip' moment.

  • On Day 2 of the Brisbane Test, Siraj flipped the bails at the striker's end to unnerve Labuschagne.
  • Labuschagne responded by flipping the bails back, much to the cheers of the crowd.
  • This playful exchange came after a previous incident between the two during the Adelaide Test.
  • Siraj received boos from the crowd upon his arrival to bowl at the Gabba after a tumultuous outing in Adelaide.
  • In a prior match, both Siraj and Labuschagne faced penalties for their heated exchanges on the field.
“Siraj later gave a fiery send-off to local boy Travis Head after dismissing him, which led to recurring boos from the crowd.”

This latest incident adds to the ongoing rivalry and drama between the players and highlights the spirited environment of international cricket.

summary:
Watch: Mohammed Siraj & Marnus Labuschagne Switch Bails At Batter's End, AUS Star Falls In Next Over

Publication Date: December 15, 2024, 13:03 IST

Source: News18

The article discusses an unusual incident during the ongoing third Test match between India and Australia, where Mohammed Siraj and Marnus Labuschagne engaged in a playful bail-swapping act during the 33rd over, which resulted in Labuschagne's dismissal shortly thereafter.

  • The incident occurred during the 33rd over of Australia's innings on Day 2 at The Gabba in Brisbane.
  • Siraj removed the bails in an attempt to distract Labuschagne, who then swapped them back.
  • Labuschagne was dismissed in the next over by Nitish Kumar Reddy after scoring 12 runs.
  • The Australian innings faced early setbacks, losing two wickets swiftly before Labuschagne's participation helped stabilize the score for a time.
  • The incident gained significant attention and went viral on social media platforms.
  • Labuschagne has been under scrutiny for his recent form despite being a leading run-scorer in WTC history.
"The bail swap trick, which led to the dismissal of many batters in the past, paid off for India as well on Sunday."

This light-hearted incident showcased the competitive spirit of the game while highlighting the growing online engagement with cricket matches. Fans have found humor and entertainment even in challenging performances on the field.

title: Diljit Dosanjh talks about Allu Arjun's Pushpa; dedicates Chandigarh concert to chess world champion Gukesh. Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
Diljit Dosanjh talks about Allu Arjun's Pushpa; dedicates Chandigarh concert to chess world champion Gukesh. Watch.

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Singer Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert in Chandigarh to newly crowned chess world champion Gukesh D. He praised Allu Arjun's film Pushpa and shared his thoughts on both topics during the performance.

  • Diljit dedicated his Chandigarh concert to Gukesh, encouraging attendees with a motivational message.
  • Gukesh D. recently became the youngest FIDE World Champion after defeating China's Ding Liren.
  • Diljit watched Pushpa: The Rise but not its sequel, Pushpa 2: The Rule, and praised the film.
  • Pushpa 2 has become the highest-grossing Indian film of 2024, earning ₹1100 crore within nine days of its release.
  • Punjab CM Bhagwant Singh Mann's wife attended the concert; an advisory was issued to avoid alcohol-themed songs during the performance.
"Today's show is dedicated to world chess champion Gukesh. Do you know why it is dedicated to him? Because whatever you think in life, he has already thought about becoming a world champion. And he became that. Problems are there, I face them daily."

Overall, Diljit Dosanjh's concert highlighted both his admiration for Gukesh's achievements in chess and his appreciation for the film Pushpa, engaging the audience with inspirational messages and entertainment.

title: India's coach falls over after getting struck on the head during 3rd Australia Gabba Test, players rush to check on him - Hindustan Times
summary:
India's Coach Falls Over After Getting Struck on the Head During 3rd Australia Gabba Test, Players Rush to Check on Him

Date: Dec 15, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

During the second day of the third Test at the Gabba, one of India's assistant coaches sustained a head injury while the team was warming up, prompting immediate concern from players and staff.

  • The incident involved Nuwan Seneviratne, India's throwdown specialist coach, who was hit on the head during a fielding drill.
  • Seneviratne fell over after being struck by a ball coming from an unexpected direction.
  • Indian players and support staff rushed to his aid, as he lay on the ground for several minutes before getting up.
  • Ice was applied to his head as he walked off the field.
  • In the match, Jasprit Bumrah made early breakthroughs for India, dismissing two Australian batsmen quickly.
“It’s a great length, indecisive, doesn’t know whether to play forward or back so gets struck on the crease.” - Aaron Finch

The incident overshadowed the match's early excitement as players showed great concern for their coach's well-being.

title: Joe Root Equals Ricky Ponting's Elite Record, Becomes 2nd Player In The World To… - News18
summary:
Joe Root Equals Ricky Ponting's Elite Record, Becomes 2nd Player In The World To…

Publication Date: December 15, 2024, 12:14 IST

Source: News18

Star English batter Joe Root joined legendary Ricky Ponting by becoming only the second cricketer to score 1500 Test runs in a calendar year on multiple occasions after achieving this feat in the ongoing third Test against New Zealand.

  • Root completed 1500 Test runs for England in 2024 by scoring 30 runs in the third Test at Seddon Park.
  • He has now amassed 1502 runs in 17 matches in 2024, following 1708 runs in 2021.
  • Root becomes the second player to exceed 1500 Test runs in a calendar year multiple times, joining Ricky Ponting.
  • Seven players in total have scored over 1500 Test runs in a single calendar year.
  • Other notable years for Ponting include 1503 runs in 2003 and 1544 runs in 2005.
"If Root manages to achieve the feat in the ongoing Test match, then he will break legendary South African all-rounder Jacques Kallis’ record and become the fastest batter in the world to score 13,000 Test runs in terms of matches."

Root has a chance to become the first English player to reach 13,000 Test runs, needing 84 more runs in the current match to achieve this milestone.

title: "Do Mongrels Simply Purr?": Sunil Gavaskar Hits Back At Australia Crowd Booing Mohammed Siraj - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Do Mongrels Simply Purr?": Sunil Gavaskar Hits Back At Australia Crowd Booing Mohammed Siraj

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Former Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar criticized Australian fans and players for their treatment of Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj after a controversial incident during the second Test in Adelaide.

  • Gavaskar condemned the hypocrisy of Australian fans, suggesting they would cheer if the roles were reversed.
  • Siraj faced criticism for a fiery send-off directed at Australian batsman Travis Head, which Gavaskar believes was unjust.
  • Despite receiving a demerit point and a 20% fine on his match fees, Gavaskar noted the importance of the Indian Premier League in reducing animosity in cricket.
  • Gavaskar humorously questioned whether Australian cricketers are "mongrels" who only bark in the context of aggressive play.
"Siraj is getting the stick from all the 'saints' in Australian cricket who, of course, were known for their impeccable behaviour on the field... So, do mongrels simply purr, or do they bark, too?" - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar's remarks highlight the double standards in cricket fan culture and emphasize a call for fair treatment of players regardless of nationality.

title: IND vs AUS: India release travelling reserves Yash Dayal, Mukesh Kumar and Navdeep Saini - The Times of India
summary:
IND vs AUS: India release travelling reserves Yash Dayal, Mukesh Kumar and Navdeep Saini

Publication Date: Not provided

Source: Times of India

BRISBANE: The Indian cricket team has decided to release travelling reserves Yash Dayal, Mukesh Kumar, and Navdeep Saini, allowing them to participate in the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy starting December 21.

  • Yash Dayal, Mukesh Kumar, and Navdeep Saini are released to gain game time before the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • The trio has been with the Indian squad for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Only two Tests remain after the Brisbane fixture, with the next matches in Melbourne and Sydney.
  • Mukesh Kumar has been on an extended trip, traveling with the India A squad before the main series.
  • Saini played one India A fixture and has been training since.
  • Yash Dayal has already returned home to prepare for the tournament for Uttar Pradesh.
"We will treat it as a three-match Test series." - Shubman Gill

In conclusion, the decision to release these players highlights India's focus on ensuring that they get valuable playing time in domestic competitions as they prepare for future challenges.

title: ‘I think we all know…’: D Gukesh clarifies if he meant to publicly call out Magnus Carlsen to a championship challenge - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘I think we all know…’: D Gukesh clarifies if he meant to publicly call out Magnus Carlsen to a championship challenge

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

D Gukesh has made headlines after becoming the youngest world chess champion. Following his victory over Ding Liren, he expressed a desire to challenge Magnus Carlsen for a match, sparking discussions in the chess community.

  • D Gukesh defeated China's Ding Liren in Game 14 to become the youngest world chess champion at age 18.
  • Despite his win, Gukesh stated he doesn't consider himself the best player, acknowledging Magnus Carlsen's status.
  • Gukesh expressed a wish to compete against Carlsen, calling it an amazing opportunity and the toughest challenge in chess.
  • Carlsen responded to Gukesh's comments, indicating he is not interested in returning to competitive play.
  • Gukesh acknowledged Carlsen's previous statements about not enjoying the championship process but remains hopeful for a match.
“Winning World Chess Championship does not mean I am the best player, obviously that is Magnus Carlsen. I want to reach the level Magnus has achieved.”
“It will be, first and most importantly the biggest challenge that I can possibly face as a chess fan and as a chess player who wants to improve himself. I would love it if Magnus comes back, he is clearly the best and probably the greatest of all time.”

D Gukesh's historic win and his remarks about Magnus Carlsen have ignited interest in the chess world, leaving fans curious about the possible return of Carlsen to the championship scene.

summary:
Virat Kohli teases Harbhajan Singh over his blazer, drops hook-step to Jitender's famous song; video goes viral

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

During a rain-affected day of the third Test between India and Australia, Virat Kohli and Harbhajan Singh engaged in a humorous and viral moment of dance and banter before the match was called off.

  • The playful exchange occurred during the first day of the third Test at The Gabba, Brisbane.
  • Kohli was seen dancing and doing the hook-step from Jitender's famous song, much to Harbhajan's amusement.
  • Harbhajan, who was in a white blazer with pink stripes, recounts the moment, saying Kohli compared him to Jitender during the chat.
  • Rain led to minimal play, with Australia scoring 28 runs without loss at the end of Day 1.
  • The match is set to resume on Day 2 at 9:50 AM local time.
“Kohli looked at me and he was like ‘Jitender idhar aa gaya?’ and then he started singing ‘Naino Mein Sapna, Sapno Mein Sajna,’” - Harbhajan Singh

The light-hearted moment between Kohli and Harbhajan not only entertained fans during the rain delay but also highlighted the camaraderie among the players as they prepare for competitive action on the field.

title: Australia’s booing crowd should know Mohammed Siraj’s back story - The Indian Express
summary:
Australia’s booing crowd should know Mohammed Siraj’s back story

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: The Indian Express

Mohammed Siraj showcased his determination in a recent match despite facing challenges during his performance against Australia, emphasizing his potential as a key player.

  • Siraj took his first wicket after 21 overs in the second Test at Adelaide.
  • He achieved figures of 4/98 in 24.4 overs during the match.
  • Throughout his initial overs, Siraj displayed impressive pace and rhythm but struggled to secure wickets.
  • His performance characterized by a mix of frustration and charm highlighted his amateurish yet endearing style.
“Siraj would look exasperated, he would wipe the sweat on his face with his untucked shirt. There has always been something charmingly amateurish about Siraj.”

Siraj's story serves as a reminder of the challenges athletes face and the perseverance required to succeed in competitive sports.
